definition: abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]

sentences.english: Dozens of years of life in haste, and all should strive for them to strive for.
sentences.chinese: 人生匆匆数十寒暑，一切都应自己去奋斗，争取。

sentences.english: "Crossing" during the struggle for the self-transcendence, "Mori" for a better future.
sentences.chinese: “渡”为自我超越的奋斗过程，“森”为美好前景。

sentences.english: Littleness and glory are the choices open to your striving and your vigilance.
sentences.chinese: 你究竟愿为卑微或为荣耀而警醒奋斗，完全操之于你。

sentences.english: 14-8 And trouble for me it'll be, fighting every day until I die.
sentences.chinese: 我的麻烦是每天奋斗直到生命结束。

sentences.english: The girl for whom he had fought all his life no longer seemed important to him.
sentences.chinese: 他为之而奋斗终生的女孩对他来说似乎已不再重要。

sentences.english: The union is oriented towards welfare capitalism.
sentences.chinese: 工会以福利资本主义为其奋斗目标。

sentences.english: I believe that’s a goal worth striving for.
sentences.chinese: 我相信那是一个值得去奋斗的目标。

sentences.english: After ten years of careful preparations, he attacked and finally conquered the State of Wu.
sentences.chinese: 经过十年艰苦奋斗，越过终于雪耻战胜吴国。

sentences.english: None of these changes will happen smoothly or easily.
sentences.chinese: 这些变化需要各方的共同奋斗，不可能一帆风顺。

sentences.english: We should carry through the principle of plain living and hard struggle.
sentences.chinese: 艰苦奋斗的精神要贯彻始终。

sentences.english: Like that boat which was moving with the wind, can the mind be without struggle?
sentences.chinese: 象那艘由于风而动的船自在，头脑能没有奋斗吗？

sentences.english: It is time for opposing factions to unite and work towards a common goal.
sentences.chinese: 现在是各对立派联合起来为共同目标而奋斗的时候了。

sentences.english: Becoming and excellent college teacher remains a goal to me.
sentences.chinese: 成为一名优秀的高校教师一直是我的奋斗目标。

sentences.english: To be around the medalists was a great honour.
sentences.chinese: 能为获得奖牌而奋斗本身就是一种莫大的荣誉。

sentences.english: Consequently, for eight weeks the costuming department strived to make this dress work.
sentences.chinese: 因此，服装部奋斗了整整八个礼拜来制作这条裙子。

sentences.english: To strive for less would be unworthy of a free and religious people.
sentences.chinese: 为蝇头小利而奋斗与一个自由与宗教民族不符。

definition: to work hard/to try to make a living
to work energetically for prosperity (of the country)
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
to have one's feet firmly planted on the ground (idiom); realistic without flights of fancy/steady and serious character
lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
to fight bravely/(fig.) to struggle/to work hard
one step, one footprint (idiom); steady progress/reliable
pinyin: yi1 bu4 yi1 ge4 jiao3 yin4

definition: to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
